The Entity is a 1982 American supernatural horror film directed by Sidney J. Furie. The film stars Barbara Hershey as a single mother in Los Angeles who is raped and tormented by an invisible assailant. The director, Sidney J. Furie, considered the film to be more of a "supernatural suspense movie" rather than a horror film. He intentionally avoided researching the actual case upon which the film is based and did not want to judge the characters and story in any way. The film was made under a tax shelter by the newly-established American Cinema International Productions and had originally been optioned to Roman Polanski. The shoot lasted a period of ten weeks, and was completed in late June 1981. The exteriors of the Moran home were shot at a house in El Segundo, while a set was constructed in Los Angeles for the home's interiors. The film had its world premiere on 25 October 2012, at the Bram Stoker International Film Festival.
